title: Animal Farm Test
description: Investigate the farm as a pig.

textFragments.text: It was a dark and stormy night. Hey! That doesn’t make any sense! That music didn’t sound dark and stormy at all! It sounds to me more like a bright and chipper morning!

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Should we go with dark and stormy, or bright and chipper

speechFragments.text: It was a dark and stormy night. <break time="500ms"/><say-as interpret-as="interjection">no way!</say-as> I'm not doing this. That doesn’t make any sense!  That music didn’t sound dark and stormy at <prosody volume="x-loud" pitch="+10%">all!</prosody>  It sounds to me more like a bright and chipper morning! Should we go with dark and stormy, or bright and chipper?

localizedResponses.cardTitle: Welcome Back to Animal Farm P.I.

textFragments.text: Welcome back to the farm! When you are ready to begin the investigation, say begin.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say begin to begin the investigation.

speechFragments.text: Welcome back to the farm! When you are ready to begin the animal farm investigation, say begin.

textFragments.text: You can end the game by saying end game.

speechFragments.text: You repeat the current location by saying repeat. End the game by saying end game or restart by saying restart.

textFragments.text: Since this is your first time here, I'll give you the intro. You play the part of Petunia the Pig and help resolve problems around Old Man MacDonald's farm as they come up. You can ask for help at any time by saying help.

speechFragments.text: Since this is your first time here, I'll give you the intro. You play the part of Petunia the Pig and help resolve problems around Old Man MacDonald's farm as they come up. You can ask for help at any time by saying help. You can stop the investigation at any time by saying stop or exit. When you are ready to begin, say begin.
Say begin to begin the investigation.

localizedResponses.cardTitle: Welcome Back to Animal Farm P.I.

textFragments.text: You have an investigation in progress. You can resume where you left off or restart.

speechFragments.text: You have an investigation in progress. You can resume where you left off or restart.
To resume, say resume. To restart, say restart. You can also ask for help by saying help.

textFragments.text: Thanks for playing Animal Farm P.I.!

speechFragments.text: Thanks for playing!

textFragments.text: That's it for this path, but there are others to explore. Would you like to end the game or try again?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Restart or end game?

speechFragments.text: That's it for this path, but there are others to explore. Would you like to end the game or try again?

textFragments.text: Oh really?  Did that music really sound dark and stormy to you? I’m guessing you might be into Depeche Mode and brood a lot. Can we please just go with bright and chipper?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say yes for bright and chipper, no for dark and stormy.

speechFragments.text: Oh really?  Does this sound dark and stormy to you?
<break time="300ms" /><phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="hɑɹʌmf">Harumph</phoneme>. I’m guessing you might be into Depeche Mode. And brood a lot. Can we please just go with bright and chipper?

textFragments.text: Good grief! When I was young, life seemed so full of promise. I had dreams you know. Big dreams. I really have better things to do. Can we please just go with bright and chipper?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say yes for bright and chipper, no for dark and stormy.

speechFragments.text: <say-as interpret-as="interjection">good grief</say-as>. <break time="250ms" /> When I was young, life seemed so full of promise. I had dreams you know. <break time="200ms" />Big dreams.<break time="100ms" />  I really have better things to do. Can we please just go with bright and chipper?

textFragments.text: You’re just not going to let this go, are you? Alright. Cards on the table. If you say no, I’m just going to start repeating myself. So how about you be a good egg, and let me go with bright and chipper?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say yes for bright and chipper, no for dark and stormy.

speechFragments.text: You’re just not going to let this go, are you. <break time="100ms" />Alright. Cards on the table. If you say no, I’m just going to start repeating myself. So how about you be a good egg, and let me go with bright and chipper?

textFragments.text: It was a bright and chipper morning at the farm. Old Man MacDonald was planning on starting up the tractor for some field work, but it looks like he's missing his keys and is not happy about it. You open your eyes at the sound of the commotion just as Old Man MacDonald storms back to the house. You sleepily look around the sty at the rest of your fellow pigs and try to decide if you should wallow a bit or go to the tractor.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Do you want to wallow in the sty or go to the tractor?

speechFragments.text: <say-as interpret-as="interjection">yadda yadda yadda</say-as>! It was a bright and chipper morning at the farm. Old Man MacDonald was starting up the tractor for some field work. <break time="200ms" />

<break time="100ms" />You open your eyes at the sound of the commotion just as Old Man MacDonald storms back to the house.  You sleepily look around the sty at the rest of your fellow pigs and try to decide if you should wallow a bit or go to the tractor.
Do you want to wallow in the sty or go to the tractor?

You sleepily look around the sty at the rest of your fellow pigs and try to decide if you should wallow a bit or go to the tractor.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Do you want to wallow in the sty or go to the tractor?

speechFragments.text: And so on and so forth. It was a bright and chipper morning at the farm. Old Man MacDonald was starting up the tractor for some field work. <break time="200ms" />

<break time="100ms" />You open your eyes at the sound of the commotion just as Old Man MacDonald storms back to the house.  You sleepily look around the sty at the rest of your fellow pigs and try to decide if you should wallow a bit or go to the tractor.
Do you want to wallow in the sty or go to the tractor?

textFragments.text: As you happily wallow in the sty, it briefly occurs to you that it’s not just mud that you’re wallowing in, but hey – you’re a pig and you’re happy! Your reverie is interrupted as you spot Terrence the rat scurrying in your direction. He’s carrying something shiny. Do you want to wait for Terrence or go to him?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Do you want to wait for Terrence, or go to him?

speechFragments.text: <break time="100ms" />As you happily wallow in the sty, it briefly occurs to you that it’s not just mud that you’re wallowing in, but hey – you’re a pig and you’re happy! <break time="100ms" />Your reverie is interrupted as you spot Terrence the rat scurrying in your direction.
He’s carrying something shiny. Do you want to wait for Terrence, or go to him?

textFragments.text: You heave yourself up from the noxious filth you’ve been luxuriating in, lumber out the sty gate and head towards the tractor.  You spot Terrence the rat scurrying towards you.  He’s carrying something shiny.  Do you want to wait for Terrence or go to him?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Do you want to wait for Terrence, or go to him?

speechFragments.text: You heave yourself up from the noxious filth you’ve been luxuriating in, lumber out the sty gate and head towards the tractor.  You spot Terrence the rat scurrying towards you.
He’s carrying something shiny.  Do you want to wait for Terrence, or go to him?

textFragments.text: As he gets closer, you can clearly see that Terrence is carrying a set of keys. Would you like to talk to Terrence or take the keys?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to talk to Terrence or take the keys?

speechFragments.text: As he gets closer, you can clearly see that Terrence is carrying a set of keys.
Would you like to talk to Terrence or take the keys?

textFragments.text: As you approach him, you can clearly see that Terrence is carrying a set of keys. Would you like to talk to Terrence or take the keys?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to talk to Terrence or take the keys?

speechFragments.text: As you approach him,, you can clearly see that Terrence is carrying a set of keys.
Would you like to talk to Terrence or take the keys?

textFragments.text: You open your mouth and make a lunge for the keys, but your porcine snout knocks Terrence back before you can grab them. Terrence seems angry, but then says he would like a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich. Hmmmm… I’ll bet if you get Terrence a sandwich you can get the tractor keys from him, and then give them back to Old Man McDonald. Let’s do it!  Would you like to go to the barn, the pond or the kitchen?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to go to the barn, the pond, or the kitchen?

speechFragments.text: You open your mouth and make a lunge for the keys, but your porcine snout knocks Terrence back before you can grab them.
<break time="250ms"/>Suddenly Terrence's eyes greedily light up.

Hmmmm… I’ll bet if you get Terrence a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich, you can get the tractor keys from him, and then give them back to Old Man McDonald. <break time="100ms" /><prosody volume="x-loud">Let’s do it!</prosody>  Would you like to go to the barn, the pond,  or the kitchen?

textFragments.text: You meet up with Terrence and talk to him.  After some back and forth, Terrence agrees to give you the keys in exchange for a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich. Well that seems simple – now all you need to do is find everything to make the sandwich! Would you like to start at the barn, the pond or the kitchen?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: You can say go to the barn, go to the pond or go to the kitchen?

speechFragments.text: You approach Terrence, expecting an exercise in patience. <break time="100ms" />
Terrence pauses for a moment and then is clearly struck by divine inspiration.

<break time="100ms"/> <prosody volume="x-loud">Well that seems simple!</prosody>Now all you need to do is find everything to make a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich!  Would you like to start at the barn, the pond, or the kitchen?

textFragments.text: As you walk to the barn and think about the sandwich, it occurs to you that you know someone with an unhealthy fixation on fish who may be able to help.  Asking around, you are directed to Milfred a catnip-addled kitty at the back of the barn. Would you like to see Milfred or talk to more animals?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to go to Milfred, or talk to more animals?

speechFragments.text: As you walk to the barn and think about the sandwich, it occurs to you that you know someone with an unhealthy fixation on fish who may be able to help.  You enter the barn to the greetings of the various occupants.
<break time="500ms"/>Would you like to go to Milfred, or talk to more animals?

textFragments.text: It’s a beautiful day!  You too!  You too!  It IS a beautiful day!  The rest of the animals are too busy eating their morning slop to talk to you.  Let me know when you’re ready to see Milfred by saying “go to Milfred”.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Let me know when you’re ready to see Milfred by saying “go to Milfred”.

speechFragments.text: <break time="500ms"/>The rest of the animals are too busy eating their morning slop to talk to you and make 20 year old music references. Let me know when you’re ready to see Milfred by saying “go to Milfred”.

textFragments.text: You head towards the back of the barn and come upon a ratty couch illuminated by a couple of lava lamps and a flickering black light.  Sprawled on the couch is a slightly mangy orange tabby snoring along to a skipping record. The cat is clutching what looks like a partially decomposed fish.  Would you like to wake up the cat, or turn off the music?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to wake up the cat, or turn off the music?

speechFragments.text: You head towards the back of the barn and come upon a ratty couch illuminated by a couple of lava lamps and a flickering black light.  Sprawled on the couch is a slightly mangy orange tabby snoring along to a skipping record.
<break time="350ms"/>The cat is clutching what looks like a partially decomposed fish.  Would you like to wake up the cat, or turn off the music?

textFragments.text: You lean in with your snout to give Milfred a gentle prod, but the horrible smell coming from the decaying fish prevents you from getting any closer. Would you still like to try to wake up Milfred, or turn off the music?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: You can say wake up Milfred, or turn off the music?

speechFragments.text: You lean in with your snout to give Milfred a gentle prod, but the horrible smell coming from the decaying fish prevents you from getting any closer.
Would you still like to try to wake up Milfred, or turn off the music?

textFragments.text: You try once again to prod Milfred, but in an attempt to avoid the fish, you accidentally bump the record player.  Oh oh – now you’ve done it. Apparently the music was keeping Milfred in dreamland.  Now he's awake and he’s not happy.  After a brief conversation, you find out that the fish is a Mackerel named Ferb and Milfred offers to trade you the mackerel in exchange for some catnip. You can try to take the mackerel or you can go to the garden to get some catnip.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: You can try to take the mackerel. Or you can go to the garden to get some catnip.

speechFragments.text: You try once again to prod Milfred, but in an attempt to avoid the fish, you accidentally bump the record player.
Well that was unfortunate.  On the bright side, Milfred is awake now - although he looks somewhat annoyed.
<break time="250ms"/>You can try to take the mackerel. Or you can go to the garden to get some catnip.

textFragments.text: You reach for the needle and accidentally bump the record player. Oh oh – now you’ve done it. Apparently the music was keeping Milfred in dreamland. textFragments.text: You look Milfred square in the eyes and slowly and deliberately reach for the mackerel. Milfred attempted to hit you with pepper spray, but accidentally pulled out an airhorn, startling himself and is now cowering under the couch with Ferb.

trueResultFragments.text: You should pickup the airhorn.

falseResultFragments.text: You can pick up the airhorn, or go to the garden.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: You can pick up the airhorn, or go to the garden.

speechFragments.text: You look Milfred square in the eyes and slowly and deliberately reach for the mackerel.

This just doesn't seem to be a good day for Milfred.  He was going to pepper spray you, but accidentally pulled out an airhorn that he's now dropped on the floor.  The startled kitty is cowering under the couch with Ferb.

trueResultFragments.text: Say pick up airhorn to pickup the airhorn.

falseResultFragments.text: You can pick up the airhorn, or go to the garden.

falseResultFragments.text: You can pick up the airhorn, or go to the garden.

trueResultFragments.text: You pickup the airhorn and leave the barn for the garden.  Milfred and Ferb don’t look like they’re going anywhere soon.  You head straight for the section labelled catnip. The crows see you returning and laugh at you. You should play the airhorn and give them their due.

falseResultFragments.text: You pickup the airhorn and leave the barn for the garden.  Milfred and Ferb don’t look like they’re going anywhere soon.  After a brisk jaunt, you arrive at the garden.  You head for the herb section and browse past some oregano to a section labelled catnip.  Several crows circle overhead. You can pick some oregano, pick some catnip, or play your airhorn.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: You can pick some oregano, pick some catnip, or play your airhorn.

textFragments.text: Looks like Milfred is still under the sofa. You drop the plastic baggy of catnip in front of the couch. An orange paw reaches out, grabs the baggy and exchanges it for Ferb, the stinky mackerel. You take the decomposing fish, place it in a tightly sealed bag and beat a hasty retreat.

trueResultFragments.text: Time to make a sandwich for Terrence.

textFragments.text: The MacDonalds are a gentle and trusting couple who never lock their front door. A habit that often works to your advantage. You snuffle your way into the kitchen and find a cell phone on the counter and a refrigerator that looks like a very promising place to find some sauerkraut. Would you like to call somebody, or look in the fridge?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to call somebody, or look in the fridge?

speechFragments.text: The MacDonalds are a gentle and trusting couple who never lock their front door. A habit that often works to your advantage.

You snuffle your way into the kitchen and find a cell phone on the counter and a refrigerator that looks like a very promising place to find some sauerkraut. Would you like to call somebody, or look in the fridge?

textFragments.text: You place a call but it doesn't go so well.  Maybe you should be more specific about who you’re calling instead of dialing some random yahoo.  You should look in the refrigerator.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: When you’re ready to look in the refrigerator, say look in fridge.

speechFragments.text: <break time="300ms"/>Well! That didn’t go so well.  Maybe you should be more specific about who you’re calling instead of dialing some random yahoo.  When you’re ready to look in the refrigerator, say look in fridge.

textFragments.text: You open the refrigerator and see a plastic container that looks like it’s got some sort of fermented cabbage in it.  That fermented cabbage may very well be the sauerkraut you’re looking for. Would you like to try the cabbage, or close the fridge?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to try the cabbage, or close the fridge?

speechFragments.text: You open the refrigerator and see a plastic container that looks like it’s got some sort of fermented cabbage in it.  That fermented cabbage may very well be the sauerkraut you’re looking for. Would you like to try the cabbage, or close the fridge?

textFragments.text: You open the container of fermented cabbage and hear the reassuring sound of gas hissing out. Only one way to make sure this is sauerkraut – you take a nice healthy bite only to fing that it's kimchee.  You find it delicious even though it gives you gas.  You should probably look somewhere else.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say close the fridge then you are ready to move on.

speechFragments.text: You open the container of fermented cabbage and hear the reassuring sound of gas hissing out.  Only one way to make sure this is sauerkraut – you take a nice healthy <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="baɪt">bite</phoneme>.

<say-as interpret-as="interjection">yowzer</say-as>! Okay that’s definitely not sauerkraut – it tastes more like <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="kɪm.t͡ʃi">kimchee</phoneme>. You find it delicious even though it gives you gas. You should probably look somewhere else. Say close the fridge when you are ready to move on.

textFragments.text: You open the container of fermented cabbage and hear the reassuring sound of gas hissing out. Only one way to make sure this is sauerkraut – you take a nice healthy bite only to fing that it's kimchee.  You find it delicious even though it gives you gas.  You should probably look somewhere else.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say close the fridge then you are ready to move on.

textFragments.text: As the refrigerator door shuts, you notice a sign on it.  It’s an advertisement for a home sauerkraut delivery service with the unlikely name of UberSauer. Their phone number is 867-5309.  Let me know when you are ready to call the delivery service.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: When you are ready, say call the delivery service.

speechFragments.text: As the refrigerator door shuts, you notice a sign on it. It’s an advertisement for a home sauerkraut delivery service with the unlikely name of UberSauer. Their phone number is 86753O9.  When you are ready, say call the delivery service.

textFragments.text: A man named Arnold picks up the phone, mistakes you for Mrs. MacDonald and promises to bring you some sauerkraut right away. Would you like to wait for Arnold, or go outside?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to wait for Arnold, or go outside?

speechFragments.text: <break time="250ms"/><say-as interpret-as="interjection">kaching</say-as>.  Home cabbage delivery. Who knew?  <break time="250ms"/>Would you like to wait for Arnold, or go outside?

textFragments.text: You open the door and see a dark haired man in a white jumpsuit with the UberSauer logo and the name Arnold on it.  He’s carrying a box that must contain the sauerkraut and is making a big show of looking everwhere but at you.  He calls for Mrs. MacDonald to no avail.  You try to get his attention, but he puts you off and eventually leaves.  Well, that wasn’t very nice of him, maybe you should try waiting outside until he returns.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say go outside when you are ready.

speechFragments.text: You open the door and see a dark haired man in a white jumpsuit with the UberSauer logo and the name Arnold on it.  He’s carrying a box that must contain the sauerkraut, and is making a big show of looking everywhere but at you.
<break time="250ms"/>You politely, but firmly, butt him with your head.
<break time="250ms"/>He pats you on your head much to your annoyance.
<break time="250ms"/>Arnold steps away from the door and then looks pointedly at you.<break time="250ms"/>
Well, that wasn’t very helpful. Maybe you should try waiting outside until he returns. Say go outside when you are ready.

textFragments.text: Leaving the house door open, you plop down lazily into some tall grass at the side of the house and quietly groom your twisty little tail.

trueResultFragments.text: Sure enough, the UberSauer delivery van screeches up again. Arnold jumps out of the van, scampers to the open front door and leans in. After a minute or two of standing patiently at the door, he shrugs, sets the package of sauerkraut down and speeds off.

falseResultFragments.text: A van with the UberSauer logo arrives in front of the house and a man in a white jumpsuit with the name "Arnold" on it gets out and scampers to the open front door. The man is carrying a package of what must be sauerkraut. He stops at the door and leans in. After a minute or two of standing patiently at the door, he shrugs, sets the package of sauerkraut down and heads back to the van.

textFragments.text: You let go of your freshly groomed tail, and after it springs back into place, grab the sauerkraut.

trueResultFragments.text: Time to make a sandwich for Terrence.

falseResultFragments.text: You should go to the barn next.

trueResultFragments.text: You should go to the pond next.

falseResultFragments.text: You can go to the pond or go to the barn next.

textFragments.text: Nothing like a bracing walk to the pond through the crisp morning air to collect your thoughts and rejoice in the solitude of nature. Unfortunately, you come upon Old Man MacDonald and he's singing to himself. Hmmm… Looks like the missing keys really got to old man MacDonald and he’s come down to the pond to feed the ducks. He sets down a leather briefcase after pulling out a loaf of bread. He takes the bread out of a plastic bag, piches the bag into a nearby wastebasket and starts feeding the ducks. You’ll need bread to make your sandwich. I bet he wouldn’t mind feeding a pig. Would you like to beg for bread, or look in the wastebasket?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to beg for bread, or look in the wastebasket?

speechFragments.text: Nothing like a bracing walk to the pond through the crisp morning air to collect your thoughts and rejoice in the solitude of nature and <break time="250ms"/><prosody volume="x-loud">Oh my!</prosody>

He sets down a beat up old leather briefcase after pulling out a loaf of bread.  He takes the bread out of a plastic bag, pitches the bag into a nearby wastebasket and starts feeding the birds.
<break time="250ms"/>You’ll need bread to make your sandwich.  I bet he wouldn’t mind feeding a pig.  Would you like to beg for bread, or look in the wastebasket?

textFragments.text: You approach Old Man MacDonald, flop on your back, wiggle your tummy and make the cutest pig noises you can think of, but the farmer ignores you.  Well, that’s just great – once again, you’ve debased yourself for nothing.  Maybe you should look in the wastebasket?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to continue begging for bread, or look in the wastebasket?

textFragments.text: Well - not much to see in there. It's a small wastebasket after all. There’s the plastic bag Old Man MacDonald pitched and a bunch of old turnips. Would you like to take the bag, or take the turnips?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Would you like to take the bag, or take the turnips?

speechFragments.text: There's propbably not going to be a whole lot in there. It's a small wastebasket after all.
After a bit of poking around, you find the bag old man MacDonald pitched, and a bunch of old turnips. Would you like to take the bag, or take the turnips?

textFragments.text: Aside from a few sad looking crumbs, the bag is empty. No…wait a minute…you look closer and see…nothing. Absolutely nothing. Zero, zilch, nada. You should take the turnips.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: When you are ready, say take the turnips.

textFragments.text: Yuck! The turnips look and smell like they’ve been in the wastebasket for quite some time. They do look about the right size for throwing though. As you grab the pile, you can't shake the ominous feeling that it might not all be turnips you're picking up. Do you want to throw the turnips at the farmer or feed them to the ducks?

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say throw turnips to throw them at the farmer, or feed the ducks to feed them to the birds.

textFragments.text: You throw some of the turnips in the water and the ducks hastily swim over to you in the hopes of finding food.  The ducks nose the turnips a few times – glare at you accusatorily and swim away. Clearly they are not amused.

The ducks dubiously poke at the turnips a few times – glare at you accusatorily, and swim away
Clearly they are not amused.   I think you should throw some turnips at the farmer.  Say throw turnips when you are ready to throw them at the farmer.

textFragments.text: You wind up and throw a large, particularly odiferous turnip at Old Man MacDonald. Oh-oh that wasn't a turnip. The farmer looks at you angrily, then grabs his briefcase and hurls it at you. The briefcase misses you and lands in the pond just out of your reach. Dop you want to throw more turnips at the farmer or feed the ducks?

speechFragments.text: You wind up for another throw at the farmer, but he looks at you and shakes his finger.
While it would probably be very entertaining, I don’t think throwing another turnip is such a good idea. Say! Why don’t you try feeding the ducks? Say feed the ducks when you want to feed the ducks.

trueResultFragments.text: You throw some of the turnips in the water. The ducks hastily swim over to you in the hopes of finding food. They really are quite forgetful. In their haste, the ducks create a wake and push the briefcase towards you. Upon reaching the turnips, the ducks realize they've been here before, glare at you and swim away. The briefcase floats to the shore. You should open the briefcase.

falseResultFragments.text: You throw some of the turnips in the water. The ducks hastily swim over to you in the hopes of finding food. You should open the briefcase.

textFragments.text: Inside the briefcase you find an inflatable rubber alligator suit and a soft blanket, and immediately ponder Old Man MacDonald's irrational fear of being swaddled by an alligator. You put on the rubber suit, grab the blanket and slither towards the farmer. Old Man MacDonald drops the loaf of bread and runs away. You pick up the bread and add it to your stash.

textFragments.text: Congratulations! You’ve got all the fixings for a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich! You make the sandwich and then head back to the tractor where you find Old Man MacDonald on his hands and knees presumably looking for his keys. Terrence the rat is leaning up against a fencepost and snickering to himself. You can give the sandwich to Old Man Macdonald or Terrence.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say give the sandwich to the farmer, or give the sandwich to Terrence

speechFragments.text: <say-as interpret-as="interjection">all righty</say-as>!  You’ve got all the fixings for a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich!

You make the sandwich and then head back to the tractor where you find old man MacDonald on his hands and knees, presumably still looking for his keys.  Terrence the rat is leaning up against a fencepost and snickering to himself.
<break time="250ms"/>  Say give the sandwich to the farmer, or give the sandwich to Terrence.

textFragments.text: You carry the sandwich to Old Man MacDonald. The farmer looks up, takes the sandwich from you and takes a large bite and immediately spits it out in disgust. He gives the sandwich back to you and goes back to searching under the tractor. Why did you think giving a stinky mackerel and sauerkraut sandwich to the farmer was a good idea? You really should give it to Terrence.

localizedResponses.repromptTextResponse: Say give sandwich to rat to give it to Terrence.

speechFragments.text: You carry the sandwich to Old Man MacDonald.
The farmer takes the sandwich from you and takes a large bite.

He gives the sandwich back to you and goes back to searching under the tractor.  Why did you think giving that stinky sandwich to the farmer was a good idea?  <break time="350ms"/>Say give sandwich to rat to give it to Terrence.

textFragments.text: You carry the sandwich to Terrence and hand it to him. Terrence drops the tractor keys and scampers off with his prized sandwich. You pick up the keys and take them to Old Man MacDonald, nudging him firmly in the seat of his pants. Old Man MacDonald takes the keys, pats you on the head and drives off in his tractor. The sun is out. Old man MacDonald is beside himself with joy and Terrence is curled up with his disgusting sandwich. He’s named it Beanie. It’s really quite disturbing.

speechFragments.text: You carry the sandwich to Terrence.
<break time="350ms"/>Terrence grabs the sandwich and takes a huge bite.
Terrence drops the tractor keys and scampers off with his prized sandwich. You pick up the keys and take them to Old Man MacDonald, nudging him firmly in the tookus.
The sun is out, and Old man MacDonald is beside himself with joy! Terrence is curled up with his sandwich. He’s named it Beanie. It’s really quite disturbing.

<break time="500ms"/>The developers at Small Basket Studios would like to thank you for playing Animal Farm P.I.. If you enjoyed it, please consider leaving us a review in the Amazon Skill Store.  We are hard at work on new and slightly off-kilter stories that should be available soon.  We would also love to hear directly from you!  Please email us with any feedback, comments and/or suggestions at developers@smallbasketstudios.com.
<break time="500ms"/>Would you like to restart or end game?

textFragments.text: You carry the sandwich to Terrence and hand it to him. Terrence drops the tractor keys and scampers off with his prized sandwich. You pick up the keys and take them to Old Man MacDonald, nudging him firmly in the seat of his pants. Old Man MacDonald takes the keys, pats you on the head and drives off in his tractor. The sun is out. Old man MacDonald is beside himself with joy and Terrence is curled up with his disgusting sandwich. He’s named it Beanie. It’s really quite disturbing.

<break time="500ms"/>The developers at Small Basket Studios would like to thank you for playing Animal Farm P.I.. If you enjoyed it, please consider leaving us a review in the Amazon Skill Store. Please email us with any feedback, comments and/or suggestions at developers@smallbasketstudios.com.
